abstract: About 29 million people watched President Obama’s press conference on a total of ten broadcast and cable channels, down about 30 percent from a similar event held last month.
snippet: About 29 million people watched President Obama’s press conference on a total of ten broadcast and cable channels, down about 30 percent from a similar event held last month.
lead_paragraph: After earning a last-minute reprieve from the judges two weeks ago, Matt Giraud did not make the cut on Wednesday’s results edition of “American Idol.” The final episode for the 23-year-old piano player from Michigan drew 21.8 million viewers at 9 p.m., according to Nielsen’s estimates, easily lifting Fox to No. 1 in the ratings for the night.

headline.main: Ratings: Obama Draws 29 Million Viewers on 10 Channels
